JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . She stood as a candidate for the elections to the legislative assembly of LOC scheduled for DATE . CARDINAL of her competitors was PERSON , a local businessman .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL minority shareholders and former employees of the local department store “ Oktyabrskiy ” asked the applicant to finance a campaign against PERSON , the majority shareholder of Oktyabrskiy and the chairman of its ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant arranged for the printing of CARDINAL copies of the following leaflet , drafted by the shareholders :
“ The Truth about K[. ]
We , shareholders of the Oktyabrskiy department store , have suffered from K[. ] We are CARDINAL employees taken hostage by that voracious big wheel . K[. ] :
DATE depreciated our stock ;
– coerced us into selling the stock for a song , threatening us with dismissal ;
– forced CARDINAL employees to resign by not letting them work ;
– paid a miserable salary and often paid us with rotten groceries ;
– having ousted the shareholders by unlawful means , he has become the department store owner .

For DATE we have been fighting for our rights in courts and other instances . The law - enforcement agencies are still powerless . In GPE and its region many people have suffered because of K[. ] ’s unlawful conduct ; but everyone is silent and money does not smell .

We , as victims of K[. ] ’s conduct , propose to write a book entitled ‘ The story of K[. ] ’s dark ORG . Let it include the story of everyone who has met that terrible man on his or her way and become his victim . His fortune was made from our tears . Do not taint yourself by supporting this man . Whatever he undertakes is damned : DATE the renovated city hall is flooded with sewage , and the ORG did not come to bless ORG on the left bank which had been built in breach of NORP canons .
We have suffered much harassment , repression and many a misfortune because of this man . Do not trust his promises , they build on our sorrows and lack of rights .
Voters ! Sign your fair judgment of K[. ] ! Say ‘ no!’ to the fortune made from the woes and tears of simple people .
We are firmly convinced that a man who breaks the PERSON should not be a parliamentarian and lawmaker .
On behalf of the shareholders : PERSON F[. ] , L. K[. ] , ORG A[. ] ” ( emphasis added ) ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was elected a member of the legislative assembly of LOC .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON challenged the election results before ORG . In particular , he claimed that by publishing the leaflet the applicant had resorted to unlawful electoral campaigning . The parties to the proceedings were PERSON and the electoral commission . The applicant was cited CARDINAL party .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected PERSON application . It found that the leaflet had called on electors to vote against Mr K. , which was a permissible form of electoral agitation . The publication of that leaflet had not breached the electoral laws . If PERSON believed that the leaflet contained untrue information damaging to his honour and reputation , it was open to him to bring defamation proceedings .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON sued the applicant and the CARDINAL signatories of the leaflet for defamation . He submitted that the italicised extracts above were untrue and that the leaflet had damaged his reputation and gravely affected the voters’ freedom of choice . He claimed compensation in respect of non - pecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . The applicant produced her evidence , including the original leaflet bearing QUANTITY signatures , the decision to issue additional shares taken by ORG of the Oktyabrskiy department store under the chairmanship of PERSON , and an official document showing that the flooding of the ground floor of the city hall had been due to a construction defect which had subsequently been corrected . Several of the minority shareholders had given oral testimony to the court , confirming the information contained in the leaflet .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE allowed Mr PERSON ’s claims , finding that the defendants had failed to prove the truthfulness of the contested extracts .

CARDINAL . Firstly , the court referred to the judgment of ORG of DATE . It found that it was bound by the finding contained in that judgment that the applicant had failed to prove the truthfulness of the statements in the leaflet .
CARDINAL . The court further found as follows .

( a ) The decision approving the issue of CARDINAL additional shares had been adopted by a general meeting of shareholders rather than by PERSON personally . That decision had previously been found lawful by a court . Although PERSON was a majority shareholder , the fact that he had a decisive vote in certain issues “ did not imply the unlawfulness of the decisions taken . For that reason the accusation blaming PERSON for the depreciation of the shares and the ousting of shareholders , as if it were unlawful conduct , was unsubstantiated . The defendants had failed to prove that PERSON had acted unlawfully ” .
( b ) It had not been shown that the depreciation had been the result of Mr K. ’s conduct rather than of another cause . Moreover , the defendants had sold their shares for MONEY each .

( c ) That there had been compulsion to sell shares had not been established . PERSON , being the chairman of ORG , had suggested that shareholders should sell their shares at the price of MONEY each . There was no evidence that he had resorted to extortion , violence or threats of violence .

( d ) The allegation that PERSON had “ forced CARDINAL employees to resign by not letting them work ” was also unsubstantiated . PERSON had not personally signed any dismissals . The employees had resigned of their own free will and the resignations had been countersigned by the director general , PERSON There had therefore been no causal link between PERSON actions and the dismissals of the employees .

( e ) The defendants had failed to prove that PERSON had been personally responsible for the payment of “ a miserable salary ” . The salary of the employees of the Oktyabrskiy department store had been comparable to the average salary in the region . Moreover , “ the notion of a miserable salary [ was ] subjective and the fact that such a salary [ had been ] paid did not imply that it was a consequence of PERSON conduct . The unlawfulness of his conduct had not been proved ” .

( f ) The defendants had not submitted any evidence proving that shareholders had been ousted by unlawful methods or that PERSON had obtained the ownership of the Oktyabrskiy department store unlawfully .

( g ) The allegation that “ whatever [ Mr K. ] undertakes is damned ” was a “ violation ” . The statement that the city hall was flooded DATE was untrue as additional construction works in the city hall had fixed the flooding problem . As to the statement about the church , the Prior of the church had confirmed that it had been built in compliance with NORP canons . Moreover , PERSON had received a “ letter of benediction ” for its construction .
CARDINAL . ORG concluded as follows :

“ The leaflet was clearly intended for [ electoral ] campaigning and essentially purported to induce , and has induced , voters to take part in the election and vote against the candidate Mr K[. ] , which is not prohibited under election law .

It has been established that [ the applicant ] was not the source of the information in the leaflet , or its author ; she merely disseminated it . As to the words , expressions and statements about [ Mr K. ’s ] property and fortune and the way it was made , they reflect the opinion and civic position of a micro - community of shareholders and former employees in respect of an existing dispute between them and the joint stock company of which Mr K[. ] is one of the directors . A judicial dispute concerning these matters is pending before ORG ...

As the court considers it proven that the dissemination of statements by the defendants has damaged Mr K[. ] ’s honour , dignity and professional reputation , it awards him MONEY against [ the applicant ] in compensation for non - pecuniary damage ... The court takes into account the nature of the statements disseminated and the fact that the leaflet was signed not only by the defendants , but also by CARDINAL other persons , which substantially reduced the defendants’ liability for the nonpecuniary damage incurred by the plaintiff . ”
CARDINAL . In the operative part of the judgment the court cited the italicised statements in the leaflet and pronounced them untrue and defamatory .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against the judgment . She submitted that ORG had incorrectly considered itself bound by the judgment of DATE , which had concerned a dispute involving a different cause of action and different parties . It had concerned a dispute over the election results between PERSON and the electoral commission ; the applicant had been a third party to that dispute . The issues relating to defamation or compensation for non - pecuniary damage had not been examined in the judgment of DATE . The applicant further maintained that the defendants had submitted evidence proving the truthfulness of the contested allegations . In particular , the witnesses had confirmed that all the statements contained in the leaflet were true . ORG findings had been contradictory . In particular , although ORG had found that PERSON PERSON , being the majority shareholder of the Okrtyabrskiy department store , had influenced its policy , it had also found , conflictingly , that PERSON had not been personally responsible for the impugned omissions . In conclusion , the applicant submitted that the judgment of DATE had violated her right to impart opinions .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal . It held as follows :

“ The conclusions of the [ ORG are correct , as it can be seen from the contents of the entire contested text that the authors presented Mr K[. ] , a candidate for election to the legislative assembly of ORG and head of [ the Oktyabrskiy department store ] as disreputable , as someone who infringes the PERSON and moral principles , who builds his fortune unlawfully and who harasses the shareholders of the Oktyabrskiy department store in various ways ...

The [ ORG allowed the claims as the defendants had not submitted evidence showing that the allegations contained in the leaflet were true . Moreover , the assessment of Mr K[. ] ’s personality was formulated in clearly insulting terms . ...

... the [ ORG correctly considered the finding made in the judgment of ORG of DATE that [ the defendants ] had failed to prove the truthfulness of the statements contained in the leaflet ... as evidence established by the courts ...

[ The applicant ’s ] arguments that the present case has a different cause of action and that the parties have different procedural status can not warrant the re - establishment of a fact that has earlier been established by a court . As ORG made an assessment of the truthfulness of the allegations contained in the leaflet , the courts are bound by that judgment ... in the determination of the present case .

[ The applicant ’s ] argument that ... the judgment violates ORG constitutional right to freedom of thought , speech and information is unfounded . The views of a citizen or a group of citizens on a certain issue , if they are distributed in written form , must be formulated in proper language .

The expressions used in the leaflet , such as ‘ voracious big ORG , ‘ that terrible man’ , ‘ his fortune was made from our ORG , ‘ whatever he undertakes is ORG , ‘ the story of K[. ] ’s dark ORG are clearly insulting , are formulated in cynical terms , give an assessment of the plaintiff ’s personality and contradict the socially acceptable norms of conduct and religious principles ...

The appeal must be dismissed because the [ ORG ] correctly assessed the evidence , rightly concluded that the statements in the leaflet were untrue and gave judgment in accordance with the substantive and procedural rules .

However , the operative part of the judgment must be clarified . Since essentially the entire leaflet contains untrue statements damaging to Mr K[. ] ’s honour , dignity and professional reputation , the list of statements that were found to have been untrue must be deleted from the operative part .

d untrue statements damaging to Mr K[. ] ’s honour , dignity and professional reputation set out in a deliberately insulting form , the degree of anguish experienced by the victim , the [ ORG ] considers it appropriate to increase , in accordance with LAW , the award in respect of non - pecuniary damage to MONEY against [ the applicant ] and to MONEY against [ the other defendants ] . ”

CARDINAL . The Federal Law of DATE on Basic Guarantees of Citizens’ Electoral Rights and the Right to Participate in Referenda ( no . CARDINAL , in force at the material time , hereafter “ LAW ” ) provides that election candidates may distribute agitation materials ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . It is prohibited to abuse the freedom of the mass media , in particular , by encouraging social , racial , ethnic or religious hatred or enmity , by calling for the usurpation of power or forcible change of the constitutional foundations of GPE or breach of the territorial integrity of GPE , by advocating war or by abusing the freedom of the mass media in any other way ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Civil Code provides that an individual may apply to a court with a request for the rectification of “ statements ” ( “ сведения ” ) that are damaging to his or her honour , dignity or professional reputation if the person who disseminated such statements does not prove their truthfulness . The aggrieved person may also claim compensation for losses and non - pecuniary damage sustained as a result of the dissemination of such statements .

CARDINAL . Resolution No . CARDINAL of ORG of GPE of DATE ( amended on DATE and in force at the material time ) provided that in order to be considered damaging statements had to be untrue and contain allegations of a breach of laws or moral principles ( commission of a dishonest act , improper behaviour in the workplace or in everyday life , etc . ) . “ Dissemination of statements ” was understood as meaning the publication of statements or their broadcasting ( section CARDINAL ) . The burden of proof was on the defendant to show that the disseminated statements were true and accurate ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Civil Code provides that a court may award compensation for non - pecuniary damage to an individual who has incurred such damage as a consequence of acts that have violated his personal nonpecuniary rights . Article CARDINAL lists , among other personal non - pecuniary rights , the dignity of a person and his / her honour , good name and professional reputation .

CARDINAL . The amount of compensation for non - pecuniary damage depends on the degree of fault of the offender and other pertinent circumstances . The court must also take into account the degree of physical or mental suffering experienced by the victim ( LAW ) . T ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . The circumstances established by a final judgment are binding on the courts . There is no need to establish those circumstances anew and they may not be contested in any future litigation by the same parties ( LAW ) .
CARDINAL . The court must decide on the claims made by the plaintiff . It may only decide on claims it has raised of its own motion where a federal law so provides ( LAW ) .
